Title: 3.0 M1; Exception shown when indexing cancelled in a workbench
description:
2.1M1, Launch Help, Start search from Search dialo in the workbench, than in a 
help browser, cancel search indexing using search dialog.
It does not happen every time, but sometimes the search results frame in the 
browser shows error instead of restarting indexing with progress from 0%.

SearchResults frame shows:

HTTP Status 500 - 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-
type Exception report
message description The server encountered an internal error () that prevented 
it from fulfilling this request.



This is very unlikely scenario that user serches from both workbench and help 
browser and also cancels indexing, neverless the exception should never show.

Title: [live sync view] revision # not shown in compare editor
description:
In the 2.1 sync view the revision number and user was shown for the
local/repository compare viewers. We currently don't show these in compare
editors shown from the live sync view.

The main problem why we don't is that the IRemoteResource interface doesn't
support retreiving these properties yet.

Title: DnD build file into ant view
description:
I would like to be able to drag and drop a build file from the navigator into
the ant view.  That way I don't have to waste time browsing to a file that I
already have visible in the navigator/packages view.

Title: Allow filtering of helper targets in Ant outline
description:
Helper targets (i.e., targets that start with "-") are currently distinguished 
with a different icon.  Would like to be able to also filter out all helper 
targets.

Title: Sort targets alphabetically in Ant outline
description:
Currently targets are ordered as they appear in the build file which makes it 
difficult to locate a target if you don't remember where it was inserted, 
especially for a larget number of targets. Instead, it would be preferable to 
sort the targets alphabetically.

Title: editor: shift tab without selected the line doesn't tab to left
description:
When i am in an editor (java editor or the standaard text editor)
and i select one line and do shift tab it tabs the line to the left.

But if i don't select the line then it just tabs the line to the right.

I think the right way is that it shouldn't matter if the line is selected or 
not.

I have tested this behaviour on more editors and some do it like eclipse does 
it now and others do tab to the left when shift is used.
So i don't know what the "standard" guidelines for this is...

Title: new IResource getLocalTimestamp method (with patch)

description:
20030625

Title: Document requirements for developing Ant tasks in self hosting workspace
description:
We need to document / add help on setting up your projects to develop Ant tasks 
so that you can use them in a self hosting situation.

We set up our Ant projects to have separate source folders for the Ant tasks 
that we contribute. And these separate source folders have separate output 
locations so that the Run-time workspace launch configuration does not add 
these output locations to the classpath entries (-dev)

Title: Quick diff results vary after reloading
description:
Eclipse 3.0M2

Writing a quick diff provider that uses a remote file as reference, it looks 
like the quick diff view is providing different results after reopening the 
file. Example:

Reference:
01: /**
02:   * First Line
03:   * Second Line
04:   */

If you delete the "second line" (03) then insert a line in front of "first 
line" (02), you get the following result:

01: /**
02:   *
03:   * First Line
04:   */

02 and 03 will now be highlighted as "Changed lines". If you close the file and 
reopen it, line 02 will be displayed as "Added line" and at the bottom of 03 
will be a "Delete line" indicator showing 02 and 03 as deleted content.

description:

my entire environment to be able to run something (when I only want to 
add/change a few vars). This makes the support hard to use, and unshareable.

Title: Version diff should check for cancel before opening compare editor
description:
build I20030718

- in the new sync view, double-clicked on an outgoing change
- hit the cancel button
- the compare editor opened anyway

In terms of timing, it was close, but I feel that I did complete the cancel 
just before the editor opened.  

Perhaps most of the work is going on during the openEditor call, in which case 
there's no support currently to back out of it.  However, if the work is done 
before the openEditor call, it should check isCanceled just before opening.

Title: [Sync View] SyncInfoSet should have a subscriber

subscriber is available via the SyncInfo objects but it isn't clear that this is
the best way. Maybe there should be a method on SyncInfoSet that returns a
subscriber. Meaning that the set can't cross subscribers.

activate the sync view).
6) Note that the Incoming Mode filter is active.

It should have remembered the one had selected.

Title: Incorrect lineAppended notification from ConsoleLineNotifier
description: The ConsoleLineNotifier will incorrectly notify that a line has been appended when the line is incomplete yet the process has terminated. Test case can be an external Ant build from bug 41156. If a line does not yet have a demiliter BUT the console process has terminated, the notifier still processes that line. This seems incorrect in general. We notify the line trackers of the incomplete line region. Then consoleChange notification arrives for the further changes to the console document including the rest of the line that was just incorrectly processed.

requesting that.  I'm just wondering about some single generic annotation to
indicate "change occured here".

Thanks,

Title: ILaunchManager#getLaunchConfigurations returns private configs
description:
The call to ILaunchManager#getLaunchConfigurations(ILaunchConfigurationType) 
returns all the configurations of the given type, including the 
*_SHARED_INFO.launch.
This is problematic because clients of the debug plug-in are not and should 
not be aware of this private launch file. (I only became aware of its purpose 
after a conversation with Darin W).  PDE and JDT (although they haven't 
realized it yet) currently blindly take the list of configurations INCLUDING 
the private one and display it the user when the "Run > Run As" shortcut is 
used.

The best way to solve this problem is for the implementation of 
getLaunchConfigurations() to filter out the private SHARED_INFO launch 
config.

Title: Ant error popups message box and prints into the console

I have been developing custom ant tasks and this popups were really nasty 
during testing phase.

that's enough.

I'd vote for removing the error popup (or at least let it be decided by the 
user through ant runtime preferences).

Title: [CVS Repo View Concurrency] UI unreponsive when repo contains a large number of folder
description:
If a repository that contains a large number of folders (1000+) is expanded, 
the fetching of the folders is fairly quick but the adding of the folders to 
the repo view takes a considerable amout of time and blocks the UI. We should 
experiment with passing the folders through in chunks to see how UI 
reponsiveness is effected.

Title: [CVS Concurrency] Checkout feedback problems
description:
Here are some areas which feedback during checkout needs improvement:

 - The task progress says how many projects are being checked out but the 
subtask does not indicate which project you are one. Either the task or a 
subtask should say something like "Checking out 2 of 10 projects". In 
addition, it should say which project is currently being checked out.

 - subtask labels are just concatenated which exposes missing punctuation. On 
checkout, the subtask line read "Checking out projects from CVS Receiving 
file: ..". There should be a period after CVS. Also, I noticed that the 
subtask line contains the same text as the title line. There's no need to 
duplicate this.

 - The progress % seems to move well but it jumps from 40% (or less) to 
completion.

 - If an error occurs, the checkout of all projects is aborted. There is no 
indication that some may have succeeded or what project failed. It is easy to 
get an error by checking out the old oeg.eclipse.vcm.tests.* plugins.

Title: LaunchConfigurationDialog and cancellation
description:
The LaunchConfigurationDialog seems to have a bunch of code for handling 
cancellation from progress monitoring that is not longer used.

Title: [CVS Concurrency] Progress Improvements for CVS sync job
description:
The progress for the CVS sync job should display how many projects (or roots) 
are being refreshed and the number of those done so far. It seems that the 
number of folders is displayed when the refrsh button is pressed but not on 
the first refresh after startup (it says it syncing al repositories).

Also, progress % seems to be off. I'm sure I've seen it move in the past 
butwith a large number of projects, it doesn't change from 0%.

Title: [CVS Concurrency] Progress for sync update and commit
description:
The progress for these command could potentially make use of the fact that the 
number of affected resources is known ahead of time. Also, progress task 
messages could also show the current project, the number of projects and the 
number of projects done so far.

Title: [Team] [CVS] SourceForge anonymous checkout fails
Race condition between console line tracker and debug terminate event
description:
I have both a console line tracker and a debug event listener registered for 
the same process. When the process terminates, I want to do different things 
in the plugin based on the messages that were written out by the process. 
However, sometimes I'm getting the process terminated event *before* the last 
call to the line tracker is made. It looks like the process termination event 
is handled by a Job worker thread, while the console line comes in on the main 
thread. They appear to happen at about the same time so it's a race to see 
which is actually called first.

I tried to use the IConsoleLineTracker.dispose() method to perform the action 
but that is not called until the launch is removed. There doesn't appear to be 
a way for the console line tracker to know if it has the last line or not.

If the code that fires the termination event were changed to wait until the 
last IConsoleLineTracker.lineAppended() method was called and returns first, 
that would take care of it. Another way would be to have a new method, say 
IConsoleLineTracker.term(), to mirror the init() method. It would be called 
after the last lines had been appended and the process was terminated, and I 
could put my what-to-do-after-termination logic there.

uses XML which has white space differences. A launch config comparator needs to 
be used for this attribute.

Title: Environment variable names all lowercased when appending to native environment
description:
To duplicate this create an external program launch configuration for the DOS 
shell. Set the Location to c:\winnt\system32\cmd.exe (or wherever cmd.exe is 
located on your version of windows), set Working directory to ${project_loc}. 
Click "run". When the shell comes up in the console window enter the "set" 
command. You will see all your environment variables in the correct case.

Now go back to the launch configuration, Environment tab, and Add a new 
environment variable named "AaA" with value "BbB". Select the option to Append 
environment to native environment. Run. Now run the "set" command again and 
notice all the environment variable names are in lower case - not just the new 
one but all the existing ones too.

Now go back to the launch configuration and select the option to replace the 
native environment, Run, "set". The environment variable names are in the 
correct case.

There are some apps where the case of these names is important. I've seen 
problems when the user gets both an uppercase and a lowercase environment 
variable with the same name set (not sure how they did this but it has 
happened).

Tested under the most recent I build and a HEAD build from last night.

Title: Cannot use user's xerces to parse targets
description:

JARs on the Ant runtime classpath.

classloader to parse the targets

finished. 

My suggestion is that we add in API for setDynamicMessage in the status line 
manager which updates the status line but when clearDynamicMessage is calls 
returns it to its previoud state.

Title: [KeyBindings] Key modes should not survive focus changes
description:
build I20030917

- in emacs mode,
- open two different editors, A and B
- type some text in both
- switch to A
- hit Esc
- switch to B
- hit Backspace
- the mode survives the switch of editors, and deletes the last word in B

Title: remote quick diff provider: too many updates

hacked in...). Anyway, here we go.

1. Have several files open, all using quick diff with the CVS head as reference
2. dirty one file
3. revert the changes
-> all documents are refetched from CVS

The reason seems to be that the RemoteRevisionQuickDiffProvider.fInput gets
never set to the correct editor input, but remains null. Whenever the
IElementStateListener gets a ContentReplaced message with paramter null, all
reference providers think they must update.

Fix is to set the fInput field in the setActiveEditor method.

Title: Workspace locked on OutOfMemoryError
description:
I20031007

I had just finished checking out the UI components from CVS and importing the
remaining binary plugins into a fresh workspace and the autobuild started.  This
was taking a very long time (~5 mins) so I switched to the progress view and
cancelled the job.  I then did a manual Rebuild All from the Project menu.  I
was confronted immediately with a dialog that read something to the effect of
"Periodic workspace" with the lock icon.  I'm not sure what it said because it
flashed by very quickly and was replaced by a Building All dialog which locked
eclipse (Cancel button disabled, no response or activity for ~10 mins).  There
are no errors in my .log file.

Killing eclipse and restarting resulted a successful autobuild.
